title: Brand's base damage is too high
body:
Simply that. His damage is higher than most midlaners across the board. Pillar of flame has such a large AOE that it is impossible to dodge so when you go to cs he'll just EW for 50% of your hp. The only skillshot is his Q which pretty much guarantees a kill if he lands it. I've tried shoving, freezing and letting the wave crash under turret, I've tried short trades and long trades, I cannot win lane against him.

You can argue his AP scaling is lower but his passive does %max health damage so he has good scaling there.

TL; DR His base damage is far too high and that damage is far too easy to get off

Edit: I am talking about Brand mid, however I am a support main, and everything I have said here applies there too. Also any mid with a mobility spell should be okay, but when I mid I play Ryze/Syndra so maybe that's where I'm going wrong

Also people say his W is easy to dodge... wat. Have you not seen how wide his W is? Syndra can hit Q's that have a similar delay and they are much smaller AOE's, so Brand can definitely hit his W on someone 90% of the time. Saying "Just dodge a massive AOE spell, it's easy" is really quite silly

Just to demonstrate the point of the damage he deals: 

Syndra Q: 50 / 95 / 140 / 185 / 230 (+ 65% AP) 

Brand W: 75 / 120 / 165 / 210 / 255 (+ 60% AP) (Non empowered. Also this is a much larger AOE ability and will add a stack of his passive to a target)

Meaning Brand W does as much damage as Syndra Q when Syndra has 500 more AP than Brand. Disclaimer: I know Syndra has more mana at all levels and her Q costs 20 less mana cross the board but as long as you don't wiff abilities as Brand you'll deal more damage than a mage mid as mage support. Also Brand support gets bonus mana regen from Spellthief's and Frostfang.

Brands w would be easier to dodge if you weren't forced in between a rock and a hard place.

Either you take the W, chunking you and setting you up, or you walk walk towards him as most brands place W behind/on you. If you walk towards them, they get an easy E>Q and potentially still hit the W.

Just so people know, 1st buy boots against Brand makes your life way easier. For that time between you having boots and him not having boots you can dodge everything. Probably more effective than an MR rush

Not saying this makes him balanced or whatever. (Not syaing he's broken or anything either.) Just genuine advice I've learned the hard way after facing many Brands

The problem with Brand is he has to use his W to POKE YOU in lane instead of using it to attempt to push you in lane which means don't keep standing next to minions when you go for last hit and he will have a very hard time dealing with most champions in either mid or bot.
Brand has to use 2 abilities and sometimes 3 just to keep a wave from pushing into his tower which means he is going to run oom before any other mage will and this will make him vulnerable to poke aswell.

To make it easier to dodge Brands W you try to poke if you see him using his W to harass you while you try to last hit so this makes him think twice when he tries to poke you and since his W is normally same range or less range then a lot of mages pokes hes easy to trade back or to outrange him if you see him pushing up to poke you. 
You also need to keep moving instead of just trying to stay still which I see a lot of low elo players do when I smurf and play Brand but when I vs Brand I dodge nearly 80% of his W's in lane and the ones he lands or if i'm greedy when CSing or i'm in an all in and i'm in a spell animation.

I'd like to see something more than the authority fallacy, and "just dodge".

Brand is a mid-range mage, if you're in range of his W you can trade back at him. He if you can bait out a brand's spells, especially if he's being agressive, he'll oom and you can all in him, or he has to back, so you can get ahead that way.

Also, his cd's early are pretty significant, especially compared to Syndra as posted in this thread. Syndra has all the tools she needs to beat brand, longer range, shorter cd's, and a smaller burst window. Not to mention a long range initiation for ganks.

Also, since most people walk away to try and avoid poke, I'd try going in every time you get close, more often than not he'll miss, and you'll be in position to punish, especially if you have an engage support.

There are also definitely comp considerations, sustain champs into brand (soraka, janna, lulu, taric, nami) all do really well in supp. In mid, you want to outrange him, or wait until he uses W to waveclear then try and poke him out.

TLDR: Learn the champ's weaknesses, and play to them. His damage isn't the issue, it really is a matter of familiarity with the champion and the ways to combat his play pattern.
